intro: Galinsoga ciliata f. vargasiana, commonly known as the hairy false fleabane, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with serrated edges, and the plant often grows in disturbed soils. It is an annual herb that can spread rapidly, making it both a weed and a potential indicator of soil disturbance.
